column4: What program in Ubuntu can I use to scan some documents as PDF?
xsane is installed by default, it is under the applications->graphics menu.  PDF is one of the options for filetype to save as.
Hmm, maybe I just missed the PDF option. I'll look again.
when it asks you for the filename, if you type name.pdf it will save as a pdf (assuming you have the type still set 'by ext'
